title.value: OC-NMN: Object-centric Compositional Neural Module Network for Generative Visual Analogical Reasoning
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: OC-NMN: Object-centric Compositional Neural Module Network for Generative Visual Analogical Reasoning

extractions.description: This paper introduces an object-centric compositional neural module network (OC-NMN) designed for visual generative reasoning tasks. The model decomposes tasks into a series of primitives applied to objects using modularity. This approach aims to improve out-of-distribution generalization by leveraging neural templates composed of neural modules. The proposed method is evaluated using a new benchmark, Arith-MNIST, which involves arithmetic operations on visual digits.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results from applying the proposed model to a new benchmark dataset called Arith-MNIST and compares it to existing baselines.
type.quote: Using this benchmark, we evaluate the systematic compositional generalization of models on a set of controlled and easily extendable axes and show the benefits of object-centric inductive biases.

name.justification: The paper addresses visual generative reasoning tasks, which fall under the domain of computer vision.
name.quote: In this work, in the context of visual reasoning, we show how modularity can be leveraged to derive a compositional data augmentation framework inspired by imagination.

name.justification: The paper specifically focuses on visual generative reasoning tasks and introduces a model designed for such tasks.
name.quote: Our model OC-NMN (Object-centric Compositional Neural Module Network) can be seen as part of the neural module networks (NMNs) family of models, adapted to generative visual analogical reasoning tasks like ARC.

name.justification: The paper proposes this new model for compositional neural module networks applied to visual reasoning tasks.
name.quote: Our method, denoted Object-centric Compositional Neural Module Network (OC-NMN), decomposes visual generative reasoning tasks into a series of primitives applied to objects without using a domain-specific language.

name.justification: The paper introduces this dataset as a new benchmark for evaluating visual reasoning models on arithmetic tasks involving MNIST digits.
name.quote: We propose a simpler set of tasks that involve a set of controlled arithmetic operations on digits.

name.justification: The model uses Slot Attention as part of its perception network to map visual inputs to object-centric slots.
name.quote: The computation steps (and parts of OC-NMN) are the following : (1) A perception network maps the visual inputs x to Ns object-centric slots using a slot attention (Locatello et al., 2020) mechanism.
